intro: Chondrilla scoparia, commonly known as the desert hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant is low-growing, with grey-green, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in summer, and it produces small, hard seeds that are dispersed by wind. Chondrilla scoparia is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions.
